headline: Best Homemade Caesar Salad Dressing
description: This Caesar salad dressing recipe uses mayo, anchovies, garlic, lemon, and Parmesan for a rich, creamy taste that's so much better than store-bought.

video.description: See how to make a classic salad with garlic croutons.
video.name: Caesar Salad Supreme

name: Best Homemade Caesar Salad Dressing
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon lemon juice, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Mince 3 cloves of garlic and place in a small bowl. Add mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, anchovies, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard; mix well to combine. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Slice remaining 3 cloves of garlic into quarters and add to hot oil. Cook and stir until brown, then remove garlic from pan. Cook bread cubes in hot flavored oil, turning frequently, until lightly browned; transfer onto a plate and season with salt and pepper.
Place lettuce in a large bowl. Add dressing, remaining Parmesan cheese, and seasoned bread cubes; toss well to coat.

review.reviewBody: So strong & flavorful. I can't eat store bought Caesar dressing any more. Delicious!

Back in the 60's in the heyday of the Space Age, I lived in Cocoa Beach, FL. There was a restaurant whose signature dish was Caesar's salad. They made a unique dressing that many tried to copy, and the best copy was published in the local paper. I use that recipe to this day, and it's very similar to your recipe, except for the addition on curry powder and eggs. I make it up in the processer or blender and keep it in a glass jar in the fridge for several weeks. I recommend you try adding about half a teaspoon of curry powder, it adds an interesting flavor and an egg or two. It thins it out and makes it richer tasting.

No anchovies...substitute caper juice to add that anchovy flavor and thin out the mentioned a little too thick dressing. No croutons...cut up some fresh bread and throw in your air fryer-390 for a couple minutes and then into the hot oil. Voila! Great dressing..........I'll make it again.
